thread.title: What’s this croc doing in my backyard?
thread.title_full: What’s this croc doing in my backyard?

title: What’s this croc doing in my backyard?
text:
Large crocodile wanders into backyard at Karumba Madura McCormack, The Courier-Mail January 1, 2017 10:41am 
LOCALS in a Far North Queensland town were caught between a croc and a hard place yesterday after the 3.5m long reptile swaggered up the street and into a backyard. 
Police were called to the Esplanade in Karumba to deal with the croc, who had been lying in a backyard from around 6am until it decided to move out to the front of the property. 
Officers and locals first attempted to funnel the croc back into the water using a barricade of wheelie bins but hay bale reinforcements had to be brought in. 
The croc stayed in his spot until wildlife experts from Cairns were able to relocate him. media_camera Wheelie bins used to hem in the croc. Pic: Qld Police media_camera
